subject: Personal Finance
title: Japan's Lost Decades
description: A short lesson to help you apply Japan's Lost Decades.

hook.text: Japan spent nearly 30 years battling deflation. Prices barely moved. Neither did the economy.

buildup.text: After a massive asset bubble burst in 1991, Japanese consumers stopped spending.

discovery.text: Falling prices led to falling wages, falling confidence, and more falling prices. A deflation trap.

twist.text: The Bank of Japan cut rates to zero. It wasn't enough. They eventually went negative.

climax.text: Japan's experience terrified other central banks and shaped the aggressive COVID-era stimulus.

punchline.text: Once deflation takes hold, escape is hard.

quiz.question: What happened to Japan after its asset bubble burst?
